column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=2. Related Work
#Text=2.1. Unsupervised Intrusion Detection Techniques
#Text=Intrusion detection mainly includes signature-based intrusion detection and anomaly-based intrusion detection .
#Text=In detail , signature-based intrusion detection is also known as rule-based intrusion detection .
#Text=Signature-based intrusion detection has a high detection rate for known attacks , but has no ability to detect attack behaviors that are not in the rule base .
#Text=Anomaly-based intrusion detection is also known as behavior-based intrusion detection .
#Text=This algorithm has the ability to detect unknown attack behavior .
#Text=Feature extraction based on accurately preprocessed network packets in anomaly-based intrusion detection is the basis for good performance .
#Text=At present , it is easy to collect a large amount of unlabeled data in intrusion detection , and it is difficult to obtain a large amount of labeled data .
#Text=Therefore , an unsupervised algorithm for intrusion detection has been introduced .
#Text=In recent years , there have been some studies based on unsupervised intrusion detection techniques .
#Text=In 2007 , Liu et al. used a hierarchical PCA model to detect intrusion behavior on the KDD99 dataset .
#Text=In 2017 , Gouveia et al. used RBM to detect intrusion behavior on the ISCX2012 dataset .
#Text=In 2018 , Farahnakian et al. used Deep Auto-encoder to detect intrusion behavior on the KDD99 dataset .
#Text=The common point of the above studies is that the preprocessing ignores the similarity between network packets .
#Text=Network packets with strong similarity relationship are closer in the similarity relation graph and have similar local proximity embedding .
#Text=The preprocessing algorithm in the above studies ignores the similarity relationship between network packets , resulting in low accuracy of intrusion detection .
#Text=Therefore , we introduce a graph representation leaning algorithm to solve the above problem .
#Text=The network packet is preprocessed by using a graph representation leaning algorithm .

#Text=In the proposed algorithm , the original features of the network packet are combined with the local proximity features describing the similarity relationship between the network packets as the input of the neural network .
#Text=The proposed algorithm adds effective features by considering the similarities between network packets .
#Text=2.2. Graph Representation Learning
#Text=Graph representation
#Text=leaning refers to the automatic extraction of proximity features of nodes in a graph .
#Text=This algorithm has achieved effects in the application of approximate semantic classification of words , handwritten character classification and so on .
#Text=The existing graph representation leaning algorithms are mainly the following , such as : Node2vec , Deepwalk , LINE .
#Text=However , Deepwalk uses a simple unbiased random walk , which does not control the direction of random walks .

#Text=Therefore , Deepwalk is easy to sample into the higher-order proximity range , which makes it impossible to accurately describe the local proximity features of the current node ; LINE does not have the ability to simultaneously sample first-order proximity and second-order proximity , so the algorithm has limitations ; Node2vec uses a random walk based on breadth first search ( BFS ) or depth first search ( DFS ) to explore the neighbor of the node .
#Text=However , random walks based on BFS or DFS are blind searches .
#Text=In other words , BFS lacks constraints on the range of random walks .

#Text=Therefore , the random walk has the probability of sampling to the source node ’s higher-order proximity , which makes it impossible to accurately extract the local proximity features of the source node that describe the similarity relationship between network packets .
#Text=Therefore , we propose a node2vec with penalty for unsupervised automatic preprocessing .
#Text=The proposed algorithm limits the range of random walks so that the sampling of random walks only occurs within the low-proximity of the source node .
#Text=Therefore , the algorithm has the ability to obtain local proximity features that accurately characterize the similarity of network packets .
#Text=The literature that we surveyed has not used the unsupervised automatic preprocessing of graph representation learning algorithm with penalty in the field of intrusion detection .

#Text=In the proposed algorithm , the original features of the network packet are combined with the local proximity features describing the similarity relationship between the network packets as the input of the neural network .
#Text=The proposed algorithm adds effective features to get better intrusion detection performance .
